title: What are some of the greatest unknowns of this world yet to be answered? - Quora

response.answer_text: While evolution of established life is relatively easy (and quite logical) to explain. What exactly started the first “spark” of life on this planet? In other words… What specifically made a microscopic inanimate object become able to “live” and gain the ability to start replicating itself? How exactly does “invisible” and ridiculously tiny particles (that we can’t even find) exert enough gravitational force to hold our universe together… when alone all matter should just fall apart and seperate? Is such a thing as true “nothingness” (an area of space where literally nothing exists inside of it on any level) even possible? Or is it an impossibility? What is the full ecosystem that exists at the bottom of the Mariana Trench? How can a seemingly intelligent species be capable of so easily convincing itself to behave in ways that are so obviously against its own self interest and longterm benefit?
